User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the AlBoursa Cars platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

VehicleListing.title: VehicleListing
VehicleListing.description: Represents a vehicle listing on the AlBoursa Cars platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the vehicle listing.

fuelType.description: Type of fuel the vehicle uses (e.g., бензин).

transmission.description: Transmission type of the vehicle (e.g., أوتوماتيكي).

city.description: City where the vehicle is located (e.g., نواكشوط).

mileage.description: Mileage of the vehicle in kilometers.

contactNumber.description: Contact phone number for the seller.

isFeatured.description: Indicates whether the listing is featured.

viewCount.description: Number of times the listing has been viewed.

postedDate.description: Date and time when the listing was posted.

ContactMessage.title: ContactMessage
ContactMessage.description: Represents a contact message sent by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the contact message.

name.description: Name of the person sending the message.

email.description: Email address of the person sending the message.

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of the person sending the message.

sentDate.description: Date and time when the message was sent.

id.description: Unique identifier for the About Us information.

content.description: The content of the About Us page.

language.description: The language of the About Us content (e.g., 'ar', 'en', 'fr').

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure has been simplified to use a top-level `listings` collection. This change was made to resolve persistent permission issues related to collectionGroup queries in the development environment. This flat structure simplifies queries and security rules, making the application more robust and easier to debug. Public data (listings, faqs) is kept separate from private user data (users). Authorization for writes on listings is now handled within the security rules by checking if the listing's `userId` field matches the authenticated user's `uid`.
